topic.name: Matter & Material Properties (Foundations)
topic.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
topic.description: 13-year academic progression (K-12) for Matter & Material Properties (Foundations) in Science & Nature

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Identify melting (ice to water) and freezing (water to ice).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Name boiling as water turning to steam.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Identify condensation on a cold glass.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Identify that a 'chair' is an object, but 'wood' is the material.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Name the material used to make a spoon (metal or plastic).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Identify composite materials (made of more than one thing, like concrete).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Identify common materials (wood, plastic, metal, glass, rock, water).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Identify changes that can go back (melting ice).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Name changes that cannot go back (burning wood, cooking egg).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Identify signs of a chemical change (bubbles, heat, color change).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Identify a sieve or strainer.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Name filtering as cleaning dirty water.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Identify magnetism as a way to separate metals.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Identify solids (blocks), liquids (water), and gases (air).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Name ice as water that is solid.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Identify matter as anything that has mass and takes up space.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Recall that heat makes things melt.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Observe a puddle drying up (evaporation).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Recall that one object can be made of different materials.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Observe that one material can make many different objects.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Observe that some materials float and some sink.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Recall that mixing salt and water can be undone.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Observe rust on an old bike.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Recall that we can pick big things out of a mixture.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Observe sand settling at the bottom of water.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Recall that liquids take the shape of their cup.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Observe steam coming from a hot pot.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Describe materials using simple words like hard, soft, rough, or smooth.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Summarize the water cycle processes (evaporation, condensation).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Explain that melting point and freezing point are the same temperature.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Explain the cooling effect of evaporation.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Defend the conservation of mass during state changes.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Summarize the difference between an object and the matter it contains.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Explain why a paper umbrella would be a bad idea (suitability).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Explain the concept of material fatigue.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Sort objects by the material they are made of.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Summarize the properties of metals (shiny, hard, conduct heat).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Explain why we use specific materials for specific jobs (e.g., glass for windows).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Connect the properties of a material to its atomic structure (simple introduction).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Explain the difference between a pure substance and a mixture.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Defend the concept of orderly design in the periodic properties of elements.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Summarize the difference between Physical Change (reversible) and Chemical Change (irreversible).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Explain that burning produces new substances (ash, smoke).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Explain the Law of Conservation of Mass in reactions.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Defend the distinction between nuclear changes and chemical changes.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Summarize how to separate salt from water (evaporation).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Explain how a filter works (traps solids, lets liquids pass).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Explain how centrifuges separate liquids of different densities.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Defend the industrial importance of separation techniques.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Summarize the properties of the three main states of matter.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Explain that gases spread out to fill a room.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Explain why gases are compressible but solids are not.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Compare boiling (fast) with evaporation (slow).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Analyze the energy transfer during phase changes (Latent Heat).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Interpret the flat lines on a temperature-time graph during melting/boiling.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Connect sublimation (solid to gas) to dry ice.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Compare the durability of a plastic cup vs. a glass cup.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Analyze why specific alloys (like steel) are used instead of pure metals.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Interpret the trade-offs in material selection (cost vs. strength).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Connect the physical state (solid/liquid) to the object's function.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Defend the stewardship of finite material resources.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Compare natural materials (wood, wool) with man-made materials (plastic, nylon).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Classify materials as magnetic or non-magnetic.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Analyze the density of materials by comparing mass and volume.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Interpret the thermal conductivity of different substances.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Compare dissolving sugar with baking a cake.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Analyze a precipitation reaction (solid forming from liquids).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Interpret the rearrangement of atoms in a chemical reaction.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Connect oxidation (rusting) to chemical change.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Compare a solution (dissolved) with a suspension (cloudy).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Analyze the process of Distillation (boiling and condensing).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Interpret a Chromatography paper (separating ink colors).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Connect solubility to temperature (saturation).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Compare the movement of particles in a solid (vibrating) vs. liquid (flowing).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Analyze the Kinetic Theory of Matter.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Interpret a heating curve showing state changes.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Connect temperature to the speed of particles.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the triple point of water.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the suitability of nanomaterials for future technology.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the environmental impact of polymer production and disposal.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the energy changes (Endothermic/Exothermic) in bonds.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate fractional distillation (separating crude oil).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the behavior of plasma as the fourth state of matter.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Construct an experiment to measure specific latent heat.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Synthesize the concept of vapor pressure with boiling point elevation.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Construct a critique of planned obsolescence in product design.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Synthesize the history of material science (Stone Age to Silicon Age).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Synthesize physical and chemical properties to identify unknown substances.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Construct balanced chemical equations for irreversible reactions.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Synthesize the factors that drive chemical reactions (entropy/enthalpy).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Construct a plan to purify a contaminated water sample.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Synthesize the principles of solubility rules.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Construct a phase diagram (Pressure vs. Temperature).

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Synthesize the Ideal Gas Law (PV=nRT) with kinetic theory.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Construct a materials profile for an engineering project based on stress/strain properties.

objectives.sub_subject_name: Physical Sciences (Matter, Energy, and the Laws of the Created World)
objectives.objective_text: Defend the laws of thermodynamics in relation to particle order (entropy).
